title: India's no.1 chess player Arjun Erigaisi faces US visa trouble, urges embassy to expedite process - The Times of India
summary:
India's Top Chess Player Arjun Erigaisi Faces US Visa Challenges

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Arjun Erigaisi, India's leading chess player, is encountering visa difficulties in the US, prompting him to appeal to the embassy for a quicker resolution.

  • Erigaisi has important chess tournaments scheduled in the US.
  • The visa issue could impact his participation in these key competitions.
  • He has urged the relevant authorities to expedite the processing of his visa application.
“I hope the embassy can resolve this matter quickly so I can compete.”

With ongoing visa troubles, Arjun Erigaisi’s upcoming chess tournaments hang in the balance, highlighting challenges faced by athletes in the current global climate.

title: "Half The Facts...": Prithvi Shaw's Cryptic Post After Mumbai Cricket Association's 'Came To Hotel A.. - NDTV Sports
Late night parties, hotel entry at 6 am": Mumbai Cricket Association hits back at Prithvi Shaw over his emotional social media post - Crictoday
summary:
Mumbai Cricket Association Responds to Prithvi Shaw's Social Media Post

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Prithvi Shaw, once touted as the next cricketing superstar, faces backlash after being dropped from the Mumbai team due to fitness issues and indiscipline. In a recent emotional social media post, he defended his career performance, but officials revealed that rule-breaking behavior was the real reason for his exclusion.

  • Shaw was recently dropped from the Mumbai team for the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • His removal was attributed to fitness issues, indiscipline, and a poor attitude.
  • Late-night parties and skipping training sessions were cited as problematic behaviors.
  • A Mumbai Cricket Association official stated that the team had to compensate for Shaw's performance during matches.
  • Other players expressed concerns over his attitude, influencing the decision to exclude him.
  • The selectors remain unaffected by Shaw's social media sentiments.
  • Shreyas Iyer emphasized the need for Shaw to address his issues maturely.
“In the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, we played with 10 fielders as we had to hide Prithvi Shaw. He was not able to stop the ball.”

Consequently, the Mumbai Cricket Association emphasizes the need for discipline and teamwork, indicating that exceptional rules will not be made for any individual player.
newTitle: Mumbai Cricket Association Responds to Prithvi Shaw's Social Media Post

title: Ravi Shastri weighs in on India's follow-on celebrations, says 'it reminded me of ... ' - The Times of India
summary:
Ravi Shastri on India's Resilience and Follow-On Celebrations

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri reflects on India's critical performance in the third Test against Australia, emphasizing the importance of celebrating resilience and how it sets the tone for future matches.

  • Shastri highlights India's resilience on the final day of the third Test, considering it a defining moment in the series.
  • Emphasizes the importance of avoiding the follow-on at the Gabba.
  • Recalls the significant last pair batting performance of Bumrah and Akash Deep.
  • Draws parallels with India's past successes, including a notable partnership at Lord's during the 2021 series against England.
  • Points out how tail-enders' performances can uplift team morale and provide psychological advantages.
  • Mentions the current standings of the series, which is tied at 1-1 ahead of the Boxing Day Test.
“You should celebrate. It required a lot of character from the last pair with 35–36 runs needed. That celebration showed, they knew the importance of that effort within the dressing room in the context of the series.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri believes that if India's key players step up, Australia will face challenges in upcoming matches.
newTitle: Ravi Shastri on India's Resilience and Follow-On Celebrations

WTC Final Scenarios: What are India's chances if they lose Border-Gavaskar Trophy? - The Times of India
summary:
India's Chances in WTC Final After Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

India’s hopes of qualifying for the World Test Championship (WTC) face a challenging outlook as the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series is tied at 1-1. A loss in the final tests could jeopardize their chances significantly.

  • India currently has a PCT of 51.75%, which is insufficient for top two standings if they lose the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Australia is likely to remain in the final regardless of their outcomes with Sri Lanka.
  • Sri Lanka could surpass India by winning their series against Australia, climbing to a PCT of 53.85%.
  • India must avoid defeat in the series and rely on strong performances from their key players to maintain their WTC aspirations.
“Anything less than a series draw or win will leave Rohit Sharma and his men watching the WTC Final from the sidelines.”

In conclusion, India's fate in the WTC Final depends on their performance in the upcoming tests and the results from competing teams.
newTitle: India's Chances in WTC Final After Border-Gavaskar Trophy

title: R Ashwin "Could Take Over ICC Or BCCI": Huge Prediction Made On Spin Great - NDTV Sports
summary:
R Ashwin "Could Take Over ICC Or BCCI": Huge Prediction Made On Spin Great

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: NDTV

Ravichandran Ashwin's abrupt retirement from international cricket has sparked discussions on his impact and potential future roles in cricket administration. Former cricketer Rashid Latif highlighted Ashwin's tactical genius and suggested he could take leadership roles in the BCCI or ICC.

  • Ashwin retired after a successful 14-year career, ending his journey with 537 Test wickets at an average of 24.
  • He played a instrumental role in India's cricketing successes, including the 2011 ODI World Cup win.
  • Rashid Latif praised Ashwin's humility and his cricketing prowess, emphasizing that he remains an exceptional player.
“He is very humble, and you wouldn't even realise that he's such a big cricketer. Best wishes to him from my side, from Pakistan.” - Rashid Latif

Ashwin's legacy is marked not just by his statistics but also by his significant contributions to Indian cricket, warranting optimism for his future influence in cricket governance.
newTitle: R Ashwin's Legacy and Future in Cricket

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Pakistan cricket captain Javed Miandad believes the PCB has emerged stronger after recent negotiations regarding the ICC Champions Trophy, which will be held in a hybrid model with some matches at neutral venues.

  • The PCB and BCCI reached a conclusion after months of negotiations over the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.
  • Pakistan's teams will play at neutral venues during significant upcoming tournaments hosted by India.
  • Miandad praised the PCB for its diplomatic approach and for not succumbing to pressure from the BCCI and the Indian government.
“I think the PCB took the sensible approach and instead of doing something rash and facing isolation in the ICC and among other cricket nations,” said Miandad to PTI.

This compromise allows Pakistan to host a major ICC event, marking a significant return to international cricket.

title: "There's One Area Of Disappointment": What Gautam Gambhir Said On R Ashwin's Career - NDTV Sports
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Reflects on R Ashwin's International Career Disappointment

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Gautam Gambhir has commented on R Ashwin's career, expressing disappointment that Ashwin did not play more One Day Internationals (ODIs) despite his prowess. As Ashwin concludes his international career, Gambhir reflects on missed opportunities in white-ball cricket.

  • R Ashwin is regarded as a Test cricket legend but has not received similar acclaim in ODIs.
  • Gambhir believes Ashwin was underutilized in ODIs and could have showcased his all-round skills.
  • Gambhir acknowledges Ashwin's evolution as a bowler but feels team dynamics affected his selection.
  • Despite Ashwin's success in Test cricket, his white-ball career ends unsatisfactorily.
"If there is one area of disappointment, it is that I feel he should have played a lot more of one-day cricket...the country could have seen his potential, not only as a bowler but an all-rounder as well." - Gautam Gambhir

In conclusion, while R Ashwin has achieved greatness in Test cricket, his potential in ODIs remains underappreciated, highlighting the complexities of player selection in cricket.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Reflects on R Ashwin's International Career Disappointment

title: South Africa batter fined for breaching ICC Code of Conduct - ICC Cricket
summary:
South Africa Batter Fined for Breaching ICC Code of Conduct

Publication Date: Date Not Provided

Source: Source Not Provided

After a disappointing match, South Africa's Klaasen was fined for a breach of conduct following his reaction to getting out, as the team struggled against Pakistan.

  • Klaasen was the last wicket to fall, with the team 81 runs short of victory.
  • Frustration led to Klaasen kicking the stumps, prompting sanctions from Match Referee Richie Richardson.
  • Pakistan, led by half-centuries from Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan, set a strong total, bolstered by Kamran Ghulam’s quick-fire 63 runs.
  • Pakistan leads the series 2-0, with the final ODI scheduled in Johannesburg on December 22.
"Klaasen kicked the stumps upon his dismissal, leading to sanctions by Match Referee Richie Richardson."

This incident highlights the importance of sportsmanship in professional cricket and the consequences that come with breaching the ICC's Code of Conduct.
newTitle: South Africa Batter Fined for Breaching ICC Code of Conduct

title: 'Like to throw something different at India': Australia chief selector defends changes in squad before Bo - The Times of India
summary:
Australia's Chief Selector Defends Squad Changes Before Boxing Day Test Against India

Date: Unknown | Source: Times of India

Ahead of the Boxing Day Test against India, Australian selectors aim to strengthen the top-order batting by introducing uncapped teenager Sam Konstas. Chief selector George Bailey emphasizes the need for a fresh approach to counter India's pace attack.

  • The current Australian top-order has struggled with low strike rates.
  • Bailey wants to introduce diverse batting styles to challenge India's bowlers.
  • Konstas offers a different approach compared to other squad members, which may enhance performance.
  • Selectors have included additional players to manage rapid fixture turnover.
“You can say the way our top three have been playing has been reasonably similar, and we'd like the ability to throw something different at India.” - George Bailey

summary:

Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin has announced his retirement from international cricket, receiving heartfelt tributes including messages from cricket legends Sachin Tendulkar and Kapil Dev.

  • Ashwin retires with 765 international wickets and 537 Test wickets.

If someone told me 25 years ago that I would have a smartphone with me and the call log on the last day of my career as an Indian cricketer would look like this, I would have had a heart attack then only. Thanks Sachin and Kapil paaji. — Ashwin (@ashwinravi99)

The resolution of the India-Pakistan Champions Trophy standoff was a win? Not by a long shot - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
The resolution of the India-Pakistan Champions Trophy standoff was a win? Not by a long shot.

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Cricinfo

The recent decision regarding the Champions Trophy matches between India and Pakistan has sparked debate, with stakeholders claiming victories, yet underlying issues in cricket governance remain apparent.

  • The PCB feels validated with its agreement, highlighting its status as an equal to the BCCI.
  • The BCCI continues to avoid playing in Pakistan.
  • The ICC secures a tournament and accompanying revenues.
  • Criticism exists over the ICC's lack of transparency and management.
  • Political tensions between India and Pakistan are intertwined with cricketing decisions.
  • Concerns over security and logistics are raised, but are seemingly downplayed by the ICC.

“It used to be said the ICC had become a mere event management company. What, then, might it be left as these days, given its lack of management of the 2023 World Cup and the fallout from the T20 World Cup this year? An event management company that is no longer managing events at all, or at least not managing them very well?”

This standoff underlines deeper issues within international cricket, where governance struggles reflect broader geopolitical tensions.
newTitle: The resolution of the India-Pakistan Champions Trophy standoff was a win? Not by a long shot.

title: F1 2025 grid complete as Hadjar gets Racing Bulls nod - The Race
summary:
F1 2025 Grid Completes with Isack Hadjar Joining Racing Bulls

Publication Date: October 27, 2023 | Source: The Race

The 2025 Formula 1 grid has finalized with rookie Isack Hadjar, who will race for Red Bull's second team, Racing Bulls. At 20 years old, he ranks as the third youngest on the grid.

  • Isack Hadjar becomes the third-youngest driver on the 2025 F1 grid.
  • After impressive performances in junior categories, he has secured a place in Formula 1.
  • Hadjar faced challenges in Formula 2 but ultimately received a promotion due to the collapse of Sergio Perez.
  • His addition means France now has three full-time drivers in F1.
  • He will partner with Yuki Tsunoda at Racing Bulls.
“It’s huge for myself, my family and all the people who have believed in me from the beginning.” – Isack Hadjar

Hadjar's promotion highlights Red Bull's commitment to nurturing young talent within the sport, positioning him as a potential star in the coming seasons.
newTitle: F1 2025 Grid Completes with Isack Hadjar Joining Racing Bulls

title: Gujarat Cricket Association Secretary In Line To Succeed Jay Shah As BCCI's Secretary: Report - News18
summary:
Gujarat Cricket Association Secretary In Line To Succeed Jay Shah As BCCI's Secretary

Publication Date: December 20, 2024, Source: News18

Jay Shah left his role as the BCCI secretary on November 30 to take charge of the ICC. The BCCI will hold a Special General Meeting on January 12, 2025, to elect a new secretary and treasurer.

  • Anil Patel, current GCA secretary, is considered a dark horse candidate.
  • BCCI must fill the secretary position by January 15, 2024.
  • Rohan Jaitley and Arun Dhumal are also seen as potential successors.
  • A new treasurer will also be appointed following Ashish Shelar's departure.
“There are no clear favourites for the post of the new BCCI secretary presently.”

The BCCI's decision is expected to impact the governance of cricket in India significantly.
newTitle: Gujarat Cricket Association Secretary In Line To Succeed Jay Shah As BCCI's Secretary

Magnus Carlsen, the reigning world chess champion, voiced his thoughts on classical chess, labeling it as potentially the worst format of the game after D Gukesh's recent crowning as world champion.
